intro: Ruellia quadrisepala, commonly known as the four-lobed ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its four sepals are prominent and often resemble petals. Ruellia quadrisepala is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
